td.content: s:28 yr old F truck driver presents with increased self destructive behavior, self destructive urges and intense nightmares over 9 months. Initial trauma: rape occurred 4/29/2010. denies any alcohol use she states she has never smoked a cigarette in her life o:patient mentioned that she has strong relationships with close cousin and best friend that are readily available in times of crisis. distant memories are impaired, difficulty counting back to seven, decline in grooming and hygiene can be observed, severe motor retardation = slow speech, movements, low energy, Patient looked tired and agitated, hypervigilant throughout exam, Recurrent thoughts of death, delusion of guilt. BDI 31, CAPS B=3,C=5,D=4 a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:in consideration of all factors, including availability and strength of support network, pt is not deemed to present an immediate threat to self or others and will remain in present course of treatment. performed BDI, CAPS, and performed socialization to treatment - Explained that symptoms were common for someone having experienced such trauma; socialization to treatment - Discussed Safety Plan; counseling about life problems - Discussed other life issues - learned that patient had concern about their drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Suggested various social services available for helping to handle their drug abuse; counseling about life problems - Discussed with patient their social support network; Psychiatric diagnostic evaluation - Completed, and ordered homework (fill out standard intake forms), homework (read handouts about PTSD therapy).

td.content: s:white F aged 28 ys with self destructive behavior c/o 4 weeks c/o self destructive urges, intense nightmares. Reports exposure to rape. o:patient describes multiple individuals she can utilize for social support in crisis, including best friend and brother who live in the area. When questioned, patient noted that she feels comfortable reaching out to either when she is in crisis. distant memories are impaired, difficulty counting back to seven, decline in grooming and hygiene can be observed, severe motor retardation = slow speech, movements, low energy, Patient looked tired and agitated, hypervigilant throughout exam, Recurrent thoughts of death, delusion of guilt. Review of intake forms done, BDI 31, Suicide assessment high a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:in consideration of all factors, including availability and strength of support network, pt is not deemed to present an immediate threat to self or others and will remain in present course of treatment. performed Review of intake forms, BDI, Suicide assessment, and performed socialization to treatment - Discussed homework - helped patient start to fill in goal worksheet; counseling about life problems - Discussed social services to help with their drug abuse; social service referral - Patient agreed they wanted to try NA; socialization to treatment - Discussed Cognitive-behavioral model of PTSD and that such treatments were mostly contraindicated until patient has stabilized and reduced level of anxiety; socialization to treatment - Discussed value of anxiety management exercises; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to list activities that were found to be relaxing; anxiety management skills - Asked patient to choose a previously close confidant to reengage with; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (finish writing goals for therapy), homework (set up appointment with social service), homework (participate in some of the activities identified as relaxing), homework (attempt to contact previously supportive person and talk with them).

td.content: s:female aged 28 years presents with 3 years history of self destructive urges, intense nightmares. she reports self destructive behavior. States that she experienced rape approx. 3 years ago. o:patient mentioned that she has a large extended family that is readily available in times of crisis. distant memories are impaired, difficulty counting back to seven, decline in grooming and hygiene can be observed, severe motor retardation = slow speech, movements, low energy, Patient looked tired and agitated, hypervigilant throughout exam, Recurrent thoughts of death, delusion of guilt. Review of patient goals done a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:in consideration of all factors, including availability and strength of support network, patient is not deemed to present an immediate threat to self or others and will remain in present course of treatment. performed Review of patient goals, and performed socialization to treatment - Reviewed Safety Plan in light of homework; counseling about life problems - Discussed patient interaction with NA; social service referral - Patient agreed to continue working with them; socialization to treatment - Reviewed relaxation activities since last appointment; socialization to treatment - Reviewed attempt to reengage with former socially supportive person; anxiety management skills - Sleep disruption exercises: discussed sleep hygiene and deep breathing for reengaging with sleep; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills), homework (Continue to participate in activities listed as relaxing), homework (Attempt to have second positive interaction with reengaged support person).

td.content: s:white f aged 28 Ys with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (approx. 3 years) complains of self destructive behavior, self destructive urges. Initial trauma: rape. o:patient describes multiple individuals she can utilize for social support in crisis, including best friend and sister who live in the area. td.content: s:28 year old f truck driver presents with severe agitation, intense nightmares and vivid flashbacks. Reports traumatized by rape, 4/29/2010. o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. CAPS B=3,C=4,D=3. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed CAPS, and performed social service referral - Discussed with patient that NA counselor was pleased with progress; anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation skill practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; anxiety management skills - Progressive muscle relaxation skill taught; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills), socialization to treatment.

td.content: s:white F truck driver aged 28 ys c/o 8 days h/o severe agitation, vivid flashbacks, intense nightmares. Initial trauma: rape. o:avoidance of thoughts associated with events, 2/3 recall at 3 times, oriented x 2, Patient looked tired, appears very agitated, hypervigilance throughout the exam, Affect was congruent. Suicide assessment moderate. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed Suicide assessment, and performed anxiety management skills - Breathing relaxation and progressive muscle relaxation skills practiced; anxiety management skills - Thought stopping skill practiced; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Socratic dialog used to help patient understand that choices made at time of the traumatic incident were rational at the time; Psychotherapy, 60 minutes - Completed, and ordered homework (practice anxiety management skills).

td.content: s:28 yr old white female presents with intrusive thoughts. pt also reports frequent vivid nightmares, moderate agitation. Initial trauma: rape. o:appropriate behavior with no abnormal movement, good eye contact, appears agitated, denies suicidal/homicidal ideation intent or plan, normal speech but slow rate, oriented x 3, poor concentration, affect is appropriate with normal range. BDI 19. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed BDI, and performed socialization to treatment - Discuss with patient the good progress that they are making in therapy: better able to face the trauma, better able to handle their drug abuse, better able to interact with others; assessment of treatment progress - Patient agrees that they also see the progress; assessment of treatment progress - Patient agrees to delay follow-up date to 1 month out; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Discuss with patient their changes in interaction with others since therapy had begun; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed.

td.content: s:white female aged 28 yrs c/o 3 weeks h/o trouble sleeping, nightmares and difficulty concentrating. Traumatized approx. 3 years ago when exposed to rape. o:good concentration, mood is euthymic, affect is appropriate with normal range, alert and oriented x 3, normal speech with normal rhythm, Heart = normal S1, S2, RRR. a:Post Traumatic Stress Disorder p:performed assessment of treatment progress - Agree to not schedule a followup unless/until patient needs one; counseling about life problems - Discuss with patient the importance of continuing to work with NA for addressing issues stemming from their drug abuse; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Review techniques that worked best for patient over course of treatment; cognitive-behavioral interventions - Review various approaches patient can use when crises arise; Psychotherapy, 45 minutes - Completed.
